comment._content: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B01E2DC1F3DE633A... CANAL NOT MUCH DAMAGED.; Wreck Containing 90 Tons of Dynamite Blown Up Near Port Said. September 29, 1905, Friday Page 5, 281 words PORT SAID, Sept. 28. -- At 9:50 o'clock this morning the wreck of the British steamer Chatham, with her cargo of ninety tons of dynamite and blasting gelatine, was blown up by mines distributed around and inside her hull. These were fired by an electric current from Raselech, about five miles away.

comment._content: Thanks for the NYT reference, very helpful.
